article:
'Storage [[protein]]s' are biological reserves of metal ions and amino acids,
used by organisms. They are found in plant seeds, egg whites, and milk.

Ferritin is an example of a storage protein that stores iron. Iron is a
component of heme, which is contained in the transport protein hemoglobin and in
cytochromes.

Some storage proteins store amino acids. Storage proteins' amino acids are used
in embryonic development of animals or plants. Two amino acid storage proteins
in animals are casein and ovalbumin.

Seeds, particularly of leguminous plants, contain high concentrations of storage
proteins. Up to 25 percent of the dry weight of the seed can be composed of
storage proteins.
